intro: Stegostyla alpina, commonly known as the alpine stegostyla, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. Stegostyla alpina thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows at high elevations.
